intro: Mercurialis caffra, commonly known as the African mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. The species is also noted for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
